WorkItem.Description:
I am using HtmlDocument.Save() with an XmlWriter in order to do some special formatting of output.
Â 
Everything seems to work great, except that entities (really & in my case) gets written out as &amp;.
It appears that the HtmlNode.WriteTo(XmlWriter) sends its "&" to XmlWriter.WriteString(), which re-escapes the & in the entity.
Would using XmlWriter.WriteRaw() be better, or does the encoding of & have to be removed before passing to WriteString() so it can be done correctly?

Comments.Message:
I just found another scenario where this causes a problem.
The ampersand in a link should also not be escaped: <a href="mypage.aspx?p=1&h=2">

I think this is a vote for using WriteRaw() instead of WriteString().
